title: 1980 Tournament Players Championship
text:
The 1980 Tournament Players Championship was a <a href="golf">golf</a> tournament in <a href="Florida">Florida</a> on the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a>, held March 20–23 at <a href="Sawgrass%20Country%20Club">Sawgrass Country Club</a> in <a href="Ponte%20Vedra%20Beach%2C%20Florida">Ponte Vedra Beach</a>, southeast of <a href="Jacksonville%2C%20Florida">Jacksonville</a>. The seventh <a href="Tournament%20Players%20Championship">Tournament Players Championship</a>, it was the fourth at Sawgrass and <a href="Lee%20Trevino">Lee Trevino</a> won at 278 (−10), one stroke ahead of runner-up <a href="Ben%20Crenshaw">Ben Crenshaw</a>.
Defending champion <a href="Lanny%20Wadkins">Lanny Wadkins</a> finished thirteen strokes back, in a tie for 45th place.
Venue.
This was the fourth of five Tournament Players Championships held at Sawgrass Country Club; it moved to the nearby <a href="TPC%20at%20Sawgrass">TPC at Sawgrass</a> Stadium Course in <a href="1982%20Tournament%20Players%20Championship">1982</a>. At the time it was scheduled to be the last at Sawgrass, but early construction delays due to weather caused the championship to return for a fifth and final year in <a href="1981%20Tournament%20Players%20Championship">1981</a>.
Eligibility requirements.
1. All designated players
<a href="Andy%20Bean">Andy Bean</a> (2), <a href="Ben%20Crenshaw">Ben Crenshaw</a> (2), <a href="Lee%20Elder">Lee Elder</a>, <a href="Raymond%20Floyd">Raymond Floyd</a> (2), <a href="Al%20Geiberger">Al Geiberger</a> (2), <a href="Bob%20Gilder">Bob Gilder</a>, <a href="David%20Graham%20%28golfer%29">David Graham</a> (2), <a href="Lou%20Graham">Lou Graham</a> (2), <a href="Hubert%20Green">Hubert Green</a> (2), <a href="Mark%20Hayes%20%28golfer%29">Mark Hayes</a>, <a href="Lon%20Hinkle">Lon Hinkle</a> (2), <a href="Hale%20Irwin">Hale Irwin</a> (2), <a href="Tom%20Kite">Tom Kite</a>, <a href="Wayne%20Levi">Wayne Levi</a> (2), <a href="Bruce%20Lietzke">Bruce Lietzke</a>, <a href="John%20Mahaffey">John Mahaffey</a>, <a href="Jerry%20McGee">Jerry McGee</a> (2), <a href="Gil%20Morgan">Gil Morgan</a> (2), <a href="Larry%20Nelson">Larry Nelson</a> (2), <a href="Jack%20Nicklaus">Jack Nicklaus</a>, <a href="Andy%20North">Andy North</a>, <a href="Jerry%20Pate">Jerry Pate</a>, <a href="Calvin%20Peete">Calvin Peete</a> (2), <a href="Gary%20Player">Gary Player</a>, <a href="Tom%20Purtzer">Tom Purtzer</a>, <a href="Jack%20Renner%20%28golfer%29">Jack Renner</a> (2), <a href="Bill%20Rogers%20%28golfer%29">Bill Rogers</a>, <a href="J.%20C.%20Snead">J. C. Snead</a>, <a href="Ed%20Sneed">Ed Sneed</a>, <a href="Dave%20Stockton">Dave Stockton</a>, <a href="Curtis%20Strange">Curtis Strange</a> (2), <a href="Lee%20Trevino">Lee Trevino</a> (2), <a href="Howard%20Twitty">Howard Twitty</a> (2), <a href="Bobby%20Wadkins">Bobby Wadkins</a>, <a href="Lanny%20Wadkins">Lanny Wadkins</a> (2), <a href="Tom%20Watson%20%28golfer%29">Tom Watson</a> (2), <a href="Fuzzy%20Zoeller">Fuzzy Zoeller</a> (2)
2. Winners of major <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> co-sponsored or approved events beginning with the 1979 Players Championship and concluding with the tournament immediately preceding the 1980 Players Championship
<a href="Bobby%20Walzel">Bobby Walzel</a>, <a href="Chi-Chi%20Rodr%C3%ADguez">Chi-Chi Rodríguez</a>, <a href="D.%20A.%20Weibring">D. A. Weibring</a>, <a href="John%20Fought">John Fought</a>, <a href="Ed%20Fiori">Ed Fiori</a>, <a href="George%20Burns%20%28golfer%29">George Burns</a>, <a href="Craig%20Stadler">Craig Stadler</a>, <a href="Jeff%20Mitchell%20%28golfer%29">Jeff Mitchell</a>, <a href="Jim%20Colbert">Jim Colbert</a>, <a href="Dave%20Eichelberger">Dave Eichelberger</a>, <a href="Johnny%20Miller">Johnny Miller</a>
3. The current <a href="1979%20Open%20Championship">British Open</a> champion
<a href="Seve%20Ballesteros">Seve Ballesteros</a>
4. Leaders in the PGA Tour Official Standings as necessary to complete the field, beginning with the 1979 Players Championship and concluding with the <a href="Jackie%20Gleason-Inverrary%20Classic">Jackie Gleason-Inverrary Classic</a>, which concludes March 9, 1980
